TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ParseException extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: Represents errors that occur when a control parses values to create a query.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ParseException object contains information about exceptions that occur when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control parses values in order to dynamically create a query.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Select%2A> property includes a property that is not in the data object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control raises a ParseException exception. The message indicates that the property does not exist in the data object.
You can assign the data object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Selecting> event by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceSelectEventArgs.Result%2A> property to an object that is returned from a query. If you select a property that does not exist in the data object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control raises a ParseException exception. The message indicates that the particular property does not exist in an `AnonymousType` object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, int32 position) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the location of the error.
Docs.value: The location where the exception occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the error message and the location of the error.
Docs.returns: The message and the position of the error.
